features: 16-piece set of wooden blocks in 4 colors for stacking, sorting, counting, and more
Develops fine motor skills, hand-eye coordination, strategic thinking and patience
Made from sturdy wood with safe, non-toxic paint; smooth, lightweight blocks
Hundreds of stacking combinations for endless hands-on play and parent-child bonding
Great educational toy for ages 1-5; enhances focus and creativity

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: GIFT4KIDS Educational balance villain building block toy 2-5 years old boys and girls birthday Christmas gift.

Children will discover many ways to play It has no set way to build it. It helps develop hand-eye coordination, attention, logic, balance and patience, and encourages strategic thinking. STACKING: Fit together in any number of creative ways. Your baby can find ways to make it more challenging and build some amazing things.

These Montessori toys for 3 year old boys and girls are perfect sorting for learning colors for toddlers. COUNTING: It is fun and simple to learn mathematics by using building blocks, and developing multiple counting methods is fun. Learning is games! SORTING: The paper with the same color can be sorted with the building blocks. You can also write the color's name on the paper and the toddler find the blocks and put them in on the right way.
Crawling Turtle Musical Toy Wooden Stacking Toy Magnetic Color & Number Maze Gift Box ✓ ✓ ✓ Suitable for Gifts ✓ ✓ ✓ Material Plastic ABS Wooden Wooden Quantity 1PCS 16PCS 1 Pcs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Way to Build Motor Skills!
reviews.reviewText: This item is great for all age groups. In our classroom we use this to lay them flat and connect them all together but we are working on the motor skills to stack them up high. This is a great item. If you have students that tend to put stuff in their mouth because it can be sanitized. Also, very durable whenever it’s snuck into the sandbox.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for open-ended/building/play
reviews.reviewText: These open-ended wooden block 'happy gingerbread men' (what my kids call them) are providing good old fashioned fun for my two kids (who are 3 and 6 years old). The paint is well coated on each piece and they are bright and attractive to children. The pieces fit into their hands nicely and they are able to stack, connect, and build with them. They also use them in conjunction with other building blocks, and have the 'gingerbread men' walk through their buildings and across their bridges.. it's really cute and I am happy we have these. When I am sitting with them I can casually talk about how many of each color there are, and if one 'goes to the store' how many are left? Or if two come home from school, how many are home now? etc. So many ways to play with these, and they are easy to put away and clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2022
reviews.reviewText: A lot of fun. I got them for my 4y/o who can play with them independently or with me. I have to admit I love playing with them too and making towers. We’ll made, unfortunately my dog like “playing” with them too

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Open-Ended Play
reviews.reviewText: These blocks are great for open-ended play. My two children (2 y/o and 5 y/o) both plays with these blocks. Each has their own way of building and playing with these blocks. It's awesome to see the different ways they play and build with them. Not only can they be used to build and stack, you can do other various activities such as sorting and counting. My husband and I were trying to stack it by balancing as well (lol).The blocks came as shown. The colors are bright and the blocks are sturdy. Whole family loves them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great early childhood toy
reviews.reviewText: This was a wonderful developmental toy for a child! It reminds me of the ones from Discovery toys, only you don't have to host any parties to get it. They are made from sturdy wood and fit together in any number of creative ways. Even my 10 year old was finding ways to make it more challenging. My niece loved this for her little one who will be 3 soon. He actually started playing with these even before the little car set he received.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Kinda hard to do for a three year old

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars They don’t stack
reviews.reviewText: They are very slippery and don’t stack well. It is difficult for myself at 30! Lol

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a gift for our kids for the holidays and found this block to be just what we wanted. Because this block is great for teaching motor skills such as sorting and building to kids. This toy will help them learn while they play and my kids love them too!
